Description: Dagger or knife with curved blade made of iron, the edge being on the inner curve; with grey horn handle and black leather sheath.
Curator's comments: Slip records "Siwe - knife. North eastern Africa." The original record suggests that it came from the Siwa Oasis in Egypt or come from the Siwi-speaking Berbers. The attribution to the Masai is modern and curatorial.
Acquisition notes: Af1888,0908.1 to 33 is a collection given by Sir John Kirk of weapons and other objects from eastern and central Africa. The gift was made after his retirement to England, and the objects come from all the stages of his long career in Africa, from 1858 to 1886. Most have their source and use recorded.
